item.title: For first-time job hunters, a college degree isn't unlocking the opportunities it once did, data shows
item.description: Data shows young college grads are feeling the brunt of the labor market slowdown.

item.title: The shutdown meant no jobs report. Here's what it would have said about the economy
item.description: While the BLS has gone dark with the shutdown, other reports suggest the labor market just plodded along in September.

item.title: Treasury Secretary Bessent says U.S. GDP could take a hit from the government shutdown
item.description: The Cabinet official spoke on the second day of the government closure.

item.title: Report shows hiring at lowest since 2009 as economists turn to alternative data during shutdown blackout
item.description: The data points fill in some gaps on information that usually comes from the Labor Department but are delayed because of the shutdown.

item.title: The government shutdown is likely to cement additional Fed interest rate cuts
item.description: Chair Jerome Powell and his fellow central bankers likely will err on the side of caution, which would be a bias towards easing.
